177.heading: Compassion.
177.title: Loyola Chin and the San Peligran Order
177.author: by Gene Yang.
notes: "High school sophomore Loyola Chin discovers that what she eats before she goes to sleep can lead her to other realms in her dreams. On one of these sojourns, she meets a mysterious man named Saint Danger, a saint who has lost his faith, who has a plan to save humankind. But his plan goes agains what Loyola feels is right. Loyola must examine her own heart and ask herself what makes us better human beings, our intelligence, or our compassion?"

221.author: [No author]
221.series: Archie's Rival Reggie) 5 p. in Archie Comics, no. 52
notes: Summary: Reggie and Archie compete to see who can mow more lawns to raise money for Saturday night dates.

222.heading: Competition.
222.title: "Playing Blocks"
222.author: Gray & Baker.
notes: Summary: Susie's brother Edwin is smart, and Tommy decides not to compete when he sees Edwin's double helix construction.

223.heading: Competition.
223.title: "Power Lunch"
223.author: by Sherrie Shepherd.
notes: Summary: It's a competition to see who can eat more.

224.heading: Competition.
224.title: Race for Your Life, Charlie Brown
224.author: Charles M
notes: Based on the feature film with the same title, written and created by Charles M. Schulz.
Summary: Charlie Brown and his friends compete in a raft race against a group of bullies who use some unsportsmanlike conduct.

225.heading: Competition.
225.title: "A Race Against Time"
225.author: by Nodell
notes: Summary: While competing in a 6-day bicycle race, Green Lantern and Doiby Dickles rescue a dog who is heir to the fortune of an eccentric millionaire.
Data from David Stepp.

226.heading: Competition.
226.title: "Space Force Threw Me Out, and You Beat my Time with Holly!"
226.author: Kirby and Wood.
notes: Summary: Headhunters are approaching the capsule, and it's time to clear something up.

228.heading: Competition.
228.title: "Stiff Competition"
228.author: Terry Richards
228.appears_in: p. 170 in Titters, the first collection of humor by women (New York : Macmillan, 1976)

229.heading: Competition.
229.title: Swan
229.author: by Ariyoshi Kyoko.
notes: (CMX Drama)

"Masumi is a 16-year old attending a small ballet school in a remote part of Japan. When she gains admission to a famous school, she finally has the chance to realize her dreams. There, due to a lack of proper training, she is the weakest student in the group. Can she endure the hardship, the struggles and the fierce competition in the world of ballet?"

230.heading: Competition.
230.title: "They Can't Let the Air Force Academy Outplay Them"
230.author: by Ed Stein.
notes: Summary: The competition in football recruiting is enormous, and the situation is degrading to coeds.

231.heading: Competition.
231.title: "Unprovoked Attack on a Hilton Hotel"
231.author: story, Jim Stenstrum ; art, Rich Corben
notes: "Sure, there was keen competition for the tourist trade. It was a multibillion dollar business. But did it have to come to this? Two galaxy-wide hotel chains locked in combat?"
Contents page title: "Attack on the Hilton."

232.heading: Competition.
232.title: "We Just Make Three Dollar Bills!"
232.author: by Art Gates
232.appears_in: 1 p. in The Human Torch, no. 8 (Summer 1942).
notes: The counterfeiter says he isn't competing with the government.
Summary: With their plane in a hockshop, Swoopy and Windy are trying hard to find the hundred bucks they need to bail it out. They'll do anything but work!"
